alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:57PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN WARREN AND CLINTON COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM EDT... At 457 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Wilmington, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Blanchester, Waynesville, Morrow, Clarksville, Harveysburg, Martinsville, Corwin, Midland, Port William, Butlerville, Pleasant Plain, Melvin, State Route 123 at State Route 132, Fort Ancient, Lumberton, Oakland, Caesar Creek State Park, Morrisville and Ogden. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 34 and 57. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
